data.enText: stung
stung

data.chText: 刺；蜇；叮
data.enText: to touch your skin or make a very small hole in it so that you feel a sharp pain

data.chText: 我的胳膊给黄蜂蜇了一下。
data.enText: I was stung on the arm by a wasp.

data.chText: 小心给荨麻扎着——荨麻有刺！
data.enText: Be careful of the nettles─they sting!

data.chText: （使）感觉刺痛，感觉灼痛
data.enText: to feel, or to make sb feel, a sharp pain in a part of their body

data.chText: 我在割破的地方抹了点抗菌剂，一时间十分刺痛。
data.enText: I put some antiseptic on the cut and it stung for a moment.

data.chText: 烟熏得我眼睛疼。
data.enText: My eyes were stinging from the smoke.

data.chText: 她流泪流得眼睛疼。
data.enText: Tears stung her eyes.

data.chText: 激怒；使不安
data.enText: to make sb feel angry or upset

data.chText: 他们的批评使他心烦意乱。
data.enText: He was stung by their criticism.

data.chText: 他们伤人的话激怒了她，使她不得不采取行动。
data.enText: Their cruel remarks stung her into action.

data.chText: 他们对政府进行了猛烈的抨击。
data.enText: They launched a stinging attack on the government.

data.chText: 对（某人）敲竹杠；敲诈；欺诈
data.enText: to charge sb more money than they expected; to charge sb who did not expect to pay

data.chText: 我挨宰了，一顿饭吃了100英镑。
data.enText: I got stung for a £100 meal.
sting sb for sth

data.chText: 向某人借钱
data.enText: to borrow money from sb
stinger

data.chText: （昆虫的）螫针，刺；（植物的）刺，刺毛
data.enText: the sharp pointed part of an insect or creature that can go into the skin leaving a small, painful and sometimes poisonous wound

data.chText: 蜜蜂的螫针
data.enText: the sting of a bee

data.chText: 蝎子尾巴上有螫针。
data.enText: The scorpion has a sting in its tail.

data.chText: 刺伤；蜇伤；叮伤
data.enText: a wound that is made when an insect, a creature or a plant stings you

data.chText: 被黄蜂或蜜蜂蜇一下疼是疼，但未必碍事。
data.enText: A wasp or bee sting is painful but not necessarily serious.

data.chText: （身体或心灵的）剧痛，痛苦
data.enText: any sharp pain in your body or mind

data.chText: 伤口上撒盐引起的剧痛
data.enText: the sting of salt in a wound

data.chText: 他冲她微微一笑，想使他的话不至于刺痛她。
data.enText: He smiled at her, trying to take the sting out of his words (= trying to make the situation less painful or difficult) .

data.chText: （警察为抓捕罪犯而设的）圈套
data.enText: a clever secret plan by the police to catch criminals

data.chText: 在底特律设圈套抓捕海洛因贩子的行动
data.enText: a sting operation to catch heroin dealers in Detroit

data.chText: （罪犯诈骗钱财的）骗局，诡计
data.enText: a clever plan by criminals to cheat people out of a lot of money
a sting in the tail

data.chText: 煞风景的结局
data.enText: an unpleasant feature that comes at the end of a story, an event, etc. and spoils it

data.text: hurt ♦ ache ♦ burn ♦ sting ♦ tingle ♦ throb

data.chText: 以上各词均可指身体部位感到疼痛。
data.enText: These are all words that can be used when part of your body feels painful.
hurt

data.chText: 指（身体部位）感到疼痛、（某一动作）引起疼痛：
data.enText: (of part of your body) to feel painful; (of an action) to cause pain

data.chText: 我脚疼。
data.enText: My feet hurt.

data.chText: 哎哟！好疼！
data.enText: Ouch! That hurt!
ache

data.chText: 指疼痛、隐痛：
data.enText: to feel a continuous dull pain

data.chText: 我周身疼痛。
data.enText: I'm aching all over.
burn

data.chText: 指（身体部位）火辣辣地痛、发烫：
data.enText: (of part of your body) to feel very hot and painful

data.chText: 空气中弥漫的化学物质熏得我们的眼睛火辣辣地痛。
data.enText: Our eyes were burning from the chemicals in the air.
sting

data.chText: 指（使）身体部位感觉刺痛、灼痛：
data.enText: to make sb feel a sharp burning pain or uncomfortable feeling in part of their body; (of part of your body) to feel this pain

data.chText: 烟熏得我眼睛痛。
data.enText: My eyes were stinging from the smoke.
tingle

data.chText: 指（身体部位）感到刺痛：
data.enText: (of part of your body) to feel as if a lot of small sharp points are pushing into the skin there

data.chText: 冷空气冻得她的脸发痛。
data.enText: The cold air made her face tingle.
throb

data.chText: 指（身体部位）有规律地抽动、抽痛：
data.enText: (of part of your body) to feel pain as a series of regular beats

data.chText: 他的头一抽一跳地痛。
data.enText: His head throbbed painfully.
to hurt/ache/burn/sting/tingle/throb from sth
Your eyes hurt/ache/burn/sting.
Your flesh/skin hurts/burns/stings/tingles.
Your head hurts/aches/throbs.
Your stomach hurts/aches.
to really hurt/ache/burn/sting/tingle/throb
to hurt/ache/sting badly/a lot
It hurts/stings/tingles.
a sting in the tail

data.chText: 煞风景的结局
data.enText: an unpleasant feature that comes at the end of a story, an event, etc. and spoils it
sting sb for sth

data.chText: 向某人借钱
data.enText: to borrow money from sb

tr: a swindle in which you cheat at gambling or persuade a person to buy worthless property
a painful wound caused by the thrust of an insect's stinger into skin
something as sudden and painful as being stung
example: he felt the stinging of nettles

tr: saddle with something disagreeable or disadvantageous
example: They stuck me with the dinner bill
I was stung with a huge tax bill
A bee stung my arm yesterday

tr: cause an emotional pain, as if by stinging
cause a sharp or stinging pain or discomfort

value.def: If a plant, animal, or insect stings you, a sharp part of it, usually covered with poison, is pushed into your skin so that you feel a sharp pain.

example.ex: I jumped as if I had been stung by a scorpion...
example.tran: 我像被蝎子蜇了似的跳了起来。

example.ex: This type of bee rarely stings.

value.def: The sting of an insect or animal is the part that stings you.

example.ex: Remove the bee sting with tweezers.
example.tran: 用镊子拔掉蜜蜂的螫刺。

value.def: If you feel a sting, you feel a sharp pain in your skin or other part of your body.

example.ex: This won't hurt — you will just feel a little sting.
example.tran: 这不痛——你只会感觉到像被轻轻叮了一下。

value.def: If a part of your body stings, or if a substance stings it, you feel a sharp pain there.

example.ex: His cheeks were stinging from the icy wind...
example.tran: 刺骨的寒风吹得他脸颊生疼。

example.ex: Never put any essential oils near the eyes. They are very strong and could sting...
example.tran: 千万不要将任何精油抹到眼睛周围。它们有很强的刺激性，可能会使眼睛产生刺痛感。
这些喷剂会使敏感肌肤感到刺痛。

value.def: If someone's remarks sting you, they make you feel hurt and annoyed.

example.ex: He's a sensitive lad and some of the criticism has stung him...
example.tran: 他是个敏感的小伙子，有些批评刺痛了他。

example.ex: She burst into tears, stung by the harshness of his words.
example.tran: 他那番严厉无情的话让她伤心得大哭起来。

example.ex: ...a stinging attack on the government's economic policy.
example.tran: 对政府经济政策的犀利抨击

value.def: A sting is a clever secret plan carried out by the police in order to catch criminals.

example.ex: The police ran a sting operation to crack down on illegal guns.
example.tran: 警方展开诱捕行动以严打非法枪支。
美国联邦调查局设下的圈套

value.tran: (警方为抓捕罪犯精心设计的)圈套

value.def: If an announcement or decision has a sting in the tail or a sting in its tail, it contains a critical and unpleasant part, normally at the end.
value.tran: 煞风景的结局;令人不愉快的结尾

value.def: If something takes the sting out of a situation, it makes it less unpleasant.

partsOfSpeech.dec: dis 分开 + tinct〔= stinct〕刺；刺激 → 把刺分开后显得清楚的；明显的 → 清楚的；明显的
dis 分开 + tinct〔= stinct〕刺；刺激 + ion，distinct 的名词 → 区别；优秀
dis 分开 + tinct〔= stinct〕刺；刺激 + ive …的 → 有区别的；与众不同的
di〔s〕分离 + stingu 刺；刺激 + ish 使… → 把不同的刺分离 → 区别
distinguish 区别；辨出 + ed 表形容词 → 与众不同的 → 著名的
ex 出 + tinct〔= stinct〕刺；刺激 → 拔出刺 → 灭绝的，注意：ex后接s开头的词根时省略s
extinct 灭绝的 + ion 表名词 → 灭绝
ex 出 + tingu 刺 + ish 使… → 把刺拔出，刺引申为火焰 → 熄灭
in 使… + stig〔= stinct〕刺；刺激 + ate 做，造成，使… → 刺激〔别人〕→ 煽动
in 向内 + stinct 刺；刺激 → 内在的刺激 → 本能
stimul 刺；刺激 + ate 做，造成，使… → 刺激，鼓励
stimul 刺；刺激 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 刺激，鼓励
sting 刺；刺激 + y …的 → 对钱的事挑刺 → 小气的
